ogallagher.marketsense

Class MarketSynth

  • java.lang.Object
    • ogallagher.marketsense.MarketSynth

  • public class MarketSynth
extends java.lang.Object
    Converts a 2D dataset to a sound, being a melody of pitches with constant timbre and amplitude using the shape of the input data. The approach is specifically designed with market asset prices in mind. The resulting sound samples can then be played and saved to audio files.
    Since:
    2021-08-11
    Author:
    Owen Gallagher

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MarketSynth.AmplitudeFormula 
      static class  MarketSynth.AudioChannels 
      class  MarketSynth.PlaybackThread 
      static class  MarketSynth.SampleRate
      Allowable sample rates (samples per second): 8000,11025,16000,22050,44100 Higher sample rate means higher range of available frequencies.
      static class  MarketSynth.SampleSize
      Allowable sample sizes, in bits: 8,16 A sample is a single position for the vibrating membrane, and the size of the sample determines the number of possible positions.
      static class  MarketSynth.TimbreFormula

      • synthesize

        public javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream synthesize(float[] marketData,
                                                       boolean normalize)
        Convert the market data to a sound, accessible via audio input stream. If marketData=null then a random sequence of length SOUND_NOTE_COUNT_DEFAULT is generated. If the market data is already normalized, use with normalize=false. TODO add a small silence between notes to allow speaker to transition between frequencies.
        Parameters:
        marketData -
        normalize - Whether to normalize the data (constrain in range [0..1]), or not. If not, the data should already be normalized. If marketData=null then this arg is ignored.

      • createTimbre

        private void createTimbre(float[] marketData,
                          float amplitude,
                          double[] timbre)
        Parameters:
        marketData -
        timbre - Output parameter into which timbre values for a single period are written.
